questions.question: Which of these is not a team sport?

choices.answer: Football
Cricket
Hockey
Snooker

questions.question: Why should you work in a team?

choices.answer: because you are told to
because certain games have to have a set amount of player
so that you can help each other and become better
So that you have someone to chat to

questions.question: Someone in your team is struggling. What should you do?

choices.answer: Shout at them
Leave them behind
See how you can help them
Tell the teacher that they should be in a different group

questions.question: You have been the only one talking in the group. What should you do?

choices.answer: Keep talking
Ask if anyone else would like to speak
Demand that someone else talk now
Refuse to say another word

questions.question: You have been writing all the answers for your group. Is that wrong?

choices.answer: No, you have the best handwriting
No, you want to do it and so you should be able to do it
Yes, you should ask others to write or, carry on
Yes, it means your team mates are lazy

questions.question: You feel shy and hate group activities. What should you do?

choices.answer: Ask a team mate to help you
Sulk
Cry
Pretend to be invisible

questions.question: In school, when should you not work together?

choices.answer: Playing rugbuy
During a test
During a class assembly
Hymn practice

questions.question: You need to find a pair. Who should you pick?

choices.answer: Someone who has the same name as you
Someone you don't know and would like to get to know better
Someone that is tall
Someone that is short

questions.question: Why do teachers sometimes put you in groups?

choices.answer: Because they think it is funny
Because they like saying the word 'Group'
Because they think you can learn from eachother
Because they love watching you argue

questions.question: Oh no! You do not agree with someone in your group. What should you do?

choices.answer: Throw them out of your group
Ignore them
Shout at them
See if you can reach an agreement and if not take a vote
